title: MultiOCR-QA: Dataset for Evaluating Robustness of LLMs in Question Answering on Multilingual OCR Texts
author: Bhawna Piryani (University of Innsbruck), Jamshid Mozafari (University of Innsbruck), Antoine Doucet (University of La Rochelle), Abdelrahman Abdallah (University of Innsbruck), Adam Jatowt (University of Innsbruck), ...
background: The paper introduces a multilingual question-answering dataset specifically tailored to assess the impact of Optical Character Recognition errors on QA systems across old documents in multiple languages.
contribution: MultiOCR-QA introduces a dataset with 60,000 question-answer pairs to evaluate the robustness of Large Language Models (LLMs) when dealing with noisy OCR-generated texts.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous datasets focused primarily on specific tasks without extensive evaluation of OCR error impacts across languages.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work provides a comprehensive analysis of how different types of OCR errors (insertions, deletions, substitutions) affect QA performance.

key_innovation: Combines both Raw and Corrected OCR text, offering a unique opportunity to investigate the robustness of QA systems under varying quality conditions.
real_world_impact: This dataset can significantly aid in developing more accurate QA systems for historical texts, potentially enhancing the usability of digital libraries and archives.
limitations: The dataset primarily covers English, French, and German, limiting its applicability to low-resource languages.

new_terms.RawOCR: **Raw OCR text** refers to the text output generated by Optical Character Recognition systems that has not been corrected for errors.
new_terms.CorrectedOCR: **Corrected OCR text** denotes the cleaned-up version of text after OCR errors have been rectified.

open_sourcing: The dataset is freely available at: https://github.com/DataScienceUIBK/MultiOCR-QA
